headline: Walgreen to pay more than $2.85 million to settle US overbilling charges
summary: The settlement partially resolves claims against the Walgreens Boots Alliance unit brought under the federal, Georgia and Massachusetts False Claims Act.  Walgreen pharmacies were accused of having from 2008 to 2023 submitted elevated "usual and customary" prices for some generic medications to the MassHealth and Georgia Medicaid programs, causing those programs to pay more for the medications than they should have.

headline: GM, Ford, Tesla, Stellantis, Nvidia, Walgreens, Jefferies, Lululemon: Stocks to watch today
summary: Stocks fell Thursday morning after President Donald Trump imposed 25% tariffs on imported autos Wednesday evening and European equities declined. The S&P 500 declined 0.6%, the Nasdaq Composite slid 0.8% and the Dow Jones Industrial Average lost 257 points, or 0.6%.

headline: Should You Buy Walgreens Boots Alliance Stock Before It Goes Private?
summary: Walgreens Boots Alliance (NASDAQ: WBA) may not be a publicly traded stock for much longer.  Earlier this month, it entered into an agreement with Sycamore Partners which will see the private equity firm acquire the pharmacy retailer for a total of $23.7 billion, including debt.  The equity value of the deal is approximately $10 billion, with Sycamore paying $11.45 per share for Walgreens.

headline: Walgreens (WBA): Buy, Sell, or Hold Post Q4 Earnings?
summary: Walgreens has had an impressive run over the past six months. While the S&P 500 has been flat, the stock has returned 22.7% and now trades at $11.12. This was partly thanks to its solid quarterly results, and the performance may have investors wondering how to approach the situation.
